---
title: "Getting Started"
---

This guide walks you through creating your first interactive map with shinymap.

## Installation

```bash
pip install shinymap
```

Or with uv:

```bash
uv add shinymap
```

## Basic Example

```python
from shiny import App, ui
from shinymap import input_map, output_map, render_map, Map
from shinymap.outline import Outline

# Define simple geometry
OUTLINE = Outline.from_dict({
    "region_a": [{"type": "rect", "x": 10, "y": 10, "width": 30, "height": 30}],
    "region_b": [{"type": "rect", "x": 50, "y": 10, "width": 30, "height": 30}],
    "region_c": [{"type": "rect", "x": 30, "y": 50, "width": 30, "height": 30}],
    "_metadata": {"viewBox": "0 0 100 100"},
})

app_ui = ui.page_fluid(
    ui.h2("My First Map"),
    input_map("selection", OUTLINE, mode="single"),
    ui.output_text("selected"),
)

def server(input, output, session):
    @output
    @render.text
    def selected():
        return f"Selected: {input.selection()}"

app = App(app_ui, server)
```
